content: The **Singapore men's national water polo team** is the representative for [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) in international men's [water polo](/wiki/Water_polo). Singapore won the gold medal in the [1954 Asian Games](/wiki/1954_Asian_Games), beating favourite Japan, 4–2 in the finals. In the [1986 Asian Games](/wiki/1986_Asian_Games), Singapore won the bronze medal on better goal difference comparing to the 4th placed team Iran. At the [Southeast Asian Games](/wiki/Southeast_Asian_Games), Singapore has traditionally been the dominant team as they won 27 consecutive gold medals. The streak finally ended at the [2019 Southeast Asian Games](/wiki/Water_polo_at_the_2019_Southeast_Asian_Games) when they ceded the title to [Indonesia](/wiki/Indonesia_men%27s_national_water_polo_team). 2019 head coach was Dejan Milakovic whereas team captain was Koh Jian Ying. 2023, Singapore regain the top spot at the games winning the gold medal again. Head coach is Kan Aoyagi. ## Results ### Olympic Games - (/wiki/Water_polo_at_the_1956_Summer_Olympics) — 10th place ### World Championships - (/wiki/Water_polo_at_the_2025_World_Aquatics_Championships_%E2%80%93_Men%27s_tournament) – 15th place ## Current squad Roster for the [2025 World Championships](/wiki/Water_polo_at_the_2025_World_Aquatics_Championships_%E2%80%93_Men%27s_tournament). Head coach: Kan Aoyagi - 1 Chou Hsiang-Ken GK - 2 Loh Zhi Zhi FP - 3 Fong Wai Chun FP - 4 Wen Zhe Goh FP - 5 Cayden Loh Dejun FP - 6 Yap Dong Xuan Ryan FP - 7 Dominic Chan Bo Xuan FP - 8 Shaunn Blasius Lok Jun Jie FP - 9 Sanjiv Rajandra FP - 10 Justin Saik Kin Yan FP - 11 See Tien Ee Jayden FP - 12 Koh Jian Ying FP - 13 Lee Kai Yang GK - 14 Matthias Goh Zoltin FP - 15 Darren Lee Jit An GK - Official website This article about sports in Singapore is a stub. title: Singapore men's national water polo team
